briefTitle: Trial of Sirolimus for Cognitive Impairment in Sturge-Weber Syndrome
officialTitle: Trial of Sirolimus for Cognitive Impairment in Sturge-Weber Syndrome
summary: The purpose of this research study is to gain a preliminary understanding of the safety of sirolimus in Sturge-Weber syndrome (SWS) and determine best outcomes to be used to assess the utility of sirolimus for the treatment of cognitive impairments related to Sturge-Weber syndrome.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change in Cognitive Function as Assessed by the National Institute of Health (NIH) Toolbox Cognitive Battery
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline and at 6 months on the study drug
